intro: Justicia geoffrayi, commonly known as the golden trumpet bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Justicia geoffrayi thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
